name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: Famous for its canopy walkway, wildlife, and peaceful natural environment.

name: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of West Africa’s largest art galleries featuring paintings, sculptures, and textiles.

name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
description: Calm, family-friendly beach ideal for swimming, picnics, and relaxation.

name: National Museum Lagos
description: Exhibits Nigeria’s cultural heritage including Nok terracotta and historical artifacts.

name: Freedom Park Lagos
description: A former colonial prison transformed into a vibrant cultural venue for concerts and events.

name: Lekki Leisure Lake
description: Offers jet skiing, quad biking, and lakeside relaxation.

name: National Theatre
description: Iconic architectural landmark for plays, concerts, and cultural festivals.

name: JJT Park
description: A clean, modern park suitable for picnics, relaxation, and photo sessions.

name: Ikeja City Mall
description: Lagos’ premier shopping mall offering movies, restaurants, and major retail brands.

name: Elegushi Beach
description: Popular beach known for nightlife, music, horse rides, and beach games.

name: Kalakuta Museum
description: Former home of Fela Kuti showcasing his life and music legacy.

name: Omu Resort
description: Offers a zoo, amusement park, aquarium, go-karts, and water rides.

name: La Campagne Tropicana
description: A luxury beachfront resort offering cultural performances and adventure activities.

name: Balogun Market
description: One of Nigeria’s busiest markets for fabrics, shoes, food, and general goods.

name: Lekki Arts & Crafts Market
description: Known for handmade crafts, jewelry, paintings, wood carvings, and souvenirs.
